name: Pineapple-Coconut Cake
author: ChellieBella
summary: Like a pineapple upside-down cake, infused with the flavors of coconut and a caramel topping. Canned pineapple keeps it very soft, moist, and not too sweet.
ingredients: 1 (15.25 ounce) can pineapple rings in juice, divided
2 tablespoons frozen whipped topping (such as Cool Whip®), thawed
directions: Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C)
Chop enough rings to fill a 1/4 cup measure
Pour 1/4 cup juice into a small bowl
Melt butter for caramel in a small saucepan
Add brown sugar, whipped topping, and vanilla extract
Whisk until smooth and bring to a boil
Pour caramel into a 9-inch round glass cake pan, coating the bottom evenly
Arrange pineapple rings over top, slicing them if desired
Sift flour, baking powder, and salt together into a bowl
Cream sugar and butter together in another bowl
Gradually add flour mixture and mix until it resembles a coarse pastry dough
Stir in coconut milk, pineapple chunks and reserved juice, and vanilla extract
Carefully pour batter over the glazed pan
Place the cake pan on top of a baking sheet and bake in the preheated oven until a toothpick inserted into the center comes out clean, 40 to 45 minutes
